name: Amstel Botel

reviews.title: amsterdam continues to be a great place
reviews.text: From Jim, Dundee, Scotland.

reviews.title: very nice
reviews.text: Visited Amsterdam again from 13-16 April 2005, and stayed at the Botel which is approximately 3-4 minutes walk from Centraal Railway Station.

reviews.title: Basic and it is
reviews.text: This is a good and very clean floating tourist hotel and with its central location you can access all the major attractions by tram or by foot .

reviews.title: Great location and generally great hotel
reviews.text: The Botel does not take children. The free channels on the Satelite TV will probably explain why, but then again individuals have the option to watch or turn off. Anyway Amsterdam is so vibrant most people only want to use their rooms for crashing out in after the excesses of the day and night and only the extremely sad would want to stay in and watch TV.

reviews.title: Great for the price!
reviews.text: The cafe bars are something else and the general atmosphere in the city is one of being totally chilled out. Restaurants are freely available to suit any price range. My personal favourite is the Ankara, a good quality Turkish Restaurant with excellent food at very reasonable prices.

Loved the botel clean and basic. We stayed with a couple of friends celebrating my wifes 40th. She wanted to go somewhere to forget it then what better place than amsterdam. Bathroom very small just managed to squeeze my 6ft 4inch frame into the shower. Friendly reception staff. Breakfast basic but plenty of it good place to stay if you want a central location for the city.
reviews.title: clean and basic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews prior to our arrival, we were filled with a little trepidation of our stay at the Amstel Botel. This was completely unfounded as we found the botel to be clean, tidy, the staff were very courtious and helpful. The room was a double and frankly very little smaller than the cabin which my wife and I shared on the P & O Arcadia last April where we paid well over £6000 pounds, albeit for 14 days and full board.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: The bar was excellent and friendly with very reasonable prices, considerably less than some of the bars in the city.
reviews.title: Botel, OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, for the money , we could find nothing to complain about and we finished our stay in Amsterdam by going next door to the Sea Palace restaurant for a fantastic meal.
reviews.title: Nice Botel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only conclude by saying that upon reading the reviews the most of the complaints about the botel were from Americans, need I say more!!
reviews.title: excellent location,comfortable room,good breakfast efficient staff,reasonable
clean, cheap accomodation
reviews.text: Amsterdam is expensive. this is a cheap, well located option. do not expect huge amounts of room though. it is clean and has a good bar . the staff are helpful. the interent connection was broken whilst i was there which was a bit annoying. we had a room on the train side, which was a bit noisy. i would ask for the water side. not bad for location -right near central station, and price.

reviews.title: Not bad, not great
reviews.text: I agree with a lot of what have been written here about the Botel. It's a good, not great location. The rooms really need some urgent renovation. Besides the decoration being ugly, there are lots of stains at the walls and ceiling, speacially in the tiny bathroom. Not pleasant, but bearable.

reviews.title: Great, Handy
reviews.text: The breakfast was good and the staff very friendly. The lobby offers a nice cooffe bar with jukebox, pool table, darts, internet and is an interesting place to hang around while resting between rides through the town.

reviews.title: At home on the Botel
reviews.text: The best feature for me and my wife, although, was that our room was almost at the level of the canal water. A complete duck family (male, female and 3 little ducks) seem to live around and got close to us looking for food. We just needed to open the window and make some duck-like noise, and there they came. If you love animals, that may be something to miss about afterwards.
If they completely renovate their rooms and bathrooms, we will be glad to stay there again.
reviews.title: so so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the end of the day this is a boat that has been converted into sleeping quarters, And all the staff have no problems in doing all they can to make your stay as comfortable as they possibly can.
reviews.title: Cant see what all the moaning is for..............

likes.liked: — location to station shops places of interest etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a twin room and the single beds are rather small but all you do is sleep in them and for a short while, because outside there is a whole new place to discover where as far as we found nobody judges anyone else in what they say or do.
reviews.title: The Botel...it's not awful, but don't make it your first choice

likes.liked: — The hotel staff i encountered (front desk, hotel manager) were very friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — The room was dingy, drab, run-down, tiny, and right next to a construction site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And to see so many smiles in one day or night is really pleasurable and makes a great change from seeing some of the Miserable faces that appear in the uk on a daily basis.
reviews.title: Basic but OK if you don't expect much luxury

reviews.text: The showers no you could not swing a cat in them but if you was in there with a cat then you need locking up.
reviews.title: Good price
great location
reviews.text: As said by other trippers the TV in the rooms have a 24 hr porn channel but as always there is the good old on and off button or even other channels to watch so the choice is yours.

First and foremost...For the high season the rates are great! Okay the positives. Very clean. asked for a non smoking and it really was a non smoking, smelled great.You have your own bathroom with a kick-ass shower. Location is awesome. Free porn! Bar in house with restaurant. Now for the negatives. Staff is not all that friendly, they were never rude it was just that they were not there to make your stay just a little more enjoyable with say even a smile or a good morning that would have been nice. The first floor should not have rooms on it due to the fact that above oh say...room 128 the bar is there and the floors are very thin and you feel and hear everyone bound for the bar or the restaurant or their 2nd floor room walking. very loud. Also we faced towards the city which is located next to the the boardwalk to the hotel and the chinese place and a 1000 other shortcuts and it is very LOUD. whats that you say? Close your window, well cannot since no airconditioning so all I am saying is that it is loud. Also on the first floor people walking by get a straight shot into the room this of course made it hard to enjoy the porn. Curtains were the type that were just about 4 inches to small so always some spot open. and the hotel is nice enough to put a bench for people to sit on right outside the door which puts it outside our window and we were lucky to get every young Brit in town drunk and loud and telling of all his conquests in the red light district which sort of made up for the porn intrusion. BOTTOM line good hotel, great price. My wife and I would stay again just ask for a room up high and on the back side where the construction is taking place.
reviews.title: Decent stay

reviews.text: Although I am a frequent visitor to Amsterdam I normally stay in a B&B more in town.However this was my wife's first trip to the city so I wanted something a bit different. Some friends of mine had previously stayed in the Botel and said it was O.K. however I did have some reservations after reading mixed reviews.
reviews.title: Good value, good location

reviews.text: I knew the hotel was in a good location being just a stones throw away from centraal station. So after researching a few booking websites (hotels.nl was by far the best deal) I took the plunge. First and formost you must try and get a canal view room which we had.But the problem was it was on the 1st (lower) floor looking at the walkway outside which was a little disappointing as it spoiled the view, but it was still better than looking at the building site and railway on the other side.
reviews.title: WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW

reviews.text: Our room was a nice size considering this was a boat and the bed was queen size too and very comfortable. And yes, the toilet/shower room is very tiny. If you are 6ft 3ins like me it is a awkward. I was nearly breaking my ribs as I sat on the loo as the sink overlaps the toilet pan!!!! The shower itself was good and powerful. Indeed, the walls are on the thin side and for one night only we had a group of students next door that stayed up chatting and laughing until 4 in the morning.
reviews.title: Good all rounder

reviews.text: The restuarant was very nice with a good breakfast selection in the morning. The bar and lounge area was quite cosy as well, with pool table,internet access, juke box, pinball table and T.V.
reviews.title: great base to explore amsterdam

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed on the botel in June for 2 nights, next time we will def stay longer. We had a great holiday, the botel is close to everything, only a short walking distance and trams are close by as well. A little warning, watch out for trams and cycle bikes, we nearly got knocked over a few times, the people on the bikes ring there bell at you to move but arn't perpared to stop.
reviews.title: loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people are put off this hotel because it is a boat, it may look like a boat but it doesn't move like one. The rooms are small but clean and functional. There is no air conditioning in the rooms, when we were staying it was about 30 degree but we were able to keep cool with the window open. We were on the bottom floor, not much of a view but we were able to watch the ducks float past.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.text: I read in a review that people complained about the smell of dope, but i didn't notice it.
reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
Great Hotel for What you pay.
reviews.text: Overall we had a great holiday and will stay again next time

reviews.title: different but nice
reviews.text: The botel has seen better days and the rooms are tiny, poorly appointed and you can hardly move in the shower rooms. A long hike from the station and all the attractions of Amsterdam. Breakfast average. Would not return.
Came here for my Girlfriends Birthday on a city break.
reviews.title: Quirky, yet needs a facelift
Great value for money
reviews.text: Enjoyed the location - easy walking distance to Amsterdam's "interesting" nightlife.
Yes the rooms are small and could do with a facelift, but they are clean & tidy and the free in-room porn channel was an unexpected bonus!
reviews.title: Unexpected Quality

reviews.text: Can recommend the floating Chinese next door to the Botel - fantastic food and views.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Overall, good cheap(ish) accomodation in a wonderful city that is a change from the usual hotel one might stay in.
reviews.title: The Amstel Botel-a good introduction to Amsterdam.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Is very well located - 2 mins walk from central station - easy to get to dam square (about 5 mins walking) and red light district (also about 5 mins) . Would definately recommend for people wanting cheap accom in good location - the only down side is that the bathroom is tiny. Also we stayed water side so I don't know how much noise would be heard if you stayed roadside with all the roadworks, but we didn't hear it at all...
reviews.title: Brilliant location

reviews.text: Not 5* but perfect for a few nights and we were more than satisfied!!
reviews.title: Basic but Ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second time we have stayed, and still cannot complain, rooms were clean, (they did not smell of tobacco etc) Bathroom small but i'm 6ft 3" and could shower without any problems. The only thing i could moan about was the smell of cigarette smoke when eating breakfast - its a non smoking area, but right next to the lounge and the smoke smell tends to drift in through the connecting door. Great if you are on a budget, easy to find even after a long day/evening in the pubs!!?!?!
reviews.title: basic

reviews.text: this served the purpose we wanted which was a bed for a couple of nights for us to return to after a day of sight seeing .
reviews.title: big hygiene issue - less than OK

reviews.text: We stayed at the Botel for almost a week during IBC conference last week.
reviews.title: OK on a budget, not worth it...

description: The Amstel Botel is Amsterdam's floating hotel. Stay in our hotel with unique design in appearance. We are located in the center of Amsterdam just 3 minutes walk from the Central Railway Station and 18 minutes ride from Amsterdam Airport, which offers a splendid opportunity to discover Amsterdam's history, culture and beauty. The Amstel Botel has 175 rooms, smoking and non-smoking rooms available, all with toilet/shower, hot/cold water, safe, AM/FM clock radio, writing desk, telephone.
